title: Mozambique attack: Timeline of terror
description: Some of those caught up in the attack on the northern city of Palma by Islamist militants share their stories.

title: Theatrics or threat: How to handle China's Communist party at 100
description: There is much debate about how to deal with the country's authoritarian politics, reports the BBC's John Sudworth.

title: Miami building collapse: 'People went to sleep, and then they died'
description: Both the mother and grandmother of Pablo Rodríguez were in the building when it fell. Now, he wants answers.

title: The Amazon sellers who sold up and became millionaires
description: Small e-commerce entrepreneurs have thrived in lockdown - now big money wants to buy them out.

title: The teen who created an app to help his sister talk
description: Sixteen-year-old Archer Calder developed an app to help his nonverbal sister Della communicate.

title: Covid-19 furlough scheme starts to be scaled back
description: As financial support reduces, we hear from a worker who has been on and off furlough for 15 months.

title: 100-year-old celebrates birthday by climbing O2 in wheelchair
description: Harry White, a veteran from east London, climbs the O2 to celebrate his 100th birthday.

title: Bill Cosby: The rise, fall and release of 'America's Dad'
description: Once a national treasure, the comedian was jailed for sexual assault but that conviction has now been overturned.

title: Jadon Sancho - A hybrid of the modern age
description: What can Manchester United fans expect from Jadon Sancho, as he returns to England four years after joining Borussia Dortmund?

title: Wimbledon 2021: Novak Djokovic, Aryna Sabalenka and Venus Williams in day three highlights
description: Watch some of the best moments from day three at Wimbledon including Katie Boulter's brilliant performance against Aryna Sabalenka and a ball boy's woes.

title: Royal Mail delivers letter addressed to 'woman in Cornwall shed'
description: The note to an author "near a village 21 miles from Land's End" finds its intended recipient.

title: Nick Grimshaw to leave Radio 1 after 14 years
description: The drivetime host says working on the station has been a "childhood dream come true".

title: Diana statue: What next for William and Harry's relationship?
description: Sources say communications have been minimal - with deep upset and mistrust on both sides.

title: Methodist Church allows same-sex marriage in 'momentous' vote
description: Church officials hope the first same-sex weddings in Methodist chapels will take place in the autumn.

title: HMS Defender: Russia's Putin accuses UK and US of military provocation
description: Russia's president says last week's naval incident off Crimea was co-ordinated to assess Moscow's response.

title: Checkatrade boss warns of shortage of skilled trade workers
description: Richard Harpin says it should be made easier for EU bathroom fitters and kitchen installers to come to the UK.

title: Covid-19: Huge crowds seek vaccine as Indonesia cases soar
description: Thousands of people surround an Indonesian vaccine centre as the country faces a severe outbreak.

title: Fifth seed Andreescu out in Wimbledon first round
description: Canadian fifth seed Bianca Andreescu suffers a first-round defeat in straight sets by France's Alize Cornet on day three at Wimbledon.

title: Raye's pain as Polydor holds release of debut album
description: The 23-year-old Call on Me singer says she's done "everything" the record label's asked her for.

title: Canada weather: Dozens dead as heatwave shatters records
description: The country has recorded its highest ever temperature - 49.6C (121.3F) - for the third day in a row.

title: Football linked to 2,000 Scottish Covid cases
description: Most of the 1,991 cases were people who travelled to London for Scotland's game with England on 18 June.

title: Euro 2020: England beat Germany - Gareth Southgate’s redemption on 'another day to remember'
description: England's 2-0 Euro 2020 win over Germany is "redemption" for manager Gareth Southgate, 25 years on from his penalty miss at Euro 96.

title: Recovered Picasso painting slips on to the floor
description: The Picasso artwork Head of a Woman was being shown off during a news conference when this happened.

title: Gracie Spinks death: Stalking victim died from stab wound to neck
description: Inquests are opened into the deaths of Gracie Spinks and the man thought to have killed her.

title: Black Widow: Scarlett Johansson's 'rousing' Marvel film impresses most critics
description: But some reviewers take issue with how the Marvel superhero film handles the exploitation of women.

title: Wimbledon 2021: Nick Kyrgios says Wimbledon grass courts are "a joke"
description: Australia's Nick Kyrgios uses a change of ends during his first round match with Ugo Humbert to tell viewers the Wimbledon grass courts are "a joke" and playing too slow.

title: What England's win means for fans
description: The victory over Germany at Wembley filled England fans with emotion – for a variety of reasons.

title: Spanish school students stuck in hotel quarantine in Majorca
description: An outbreak linked to end-of-year trips to Majorca prompts authorities to isolate the teenagers.

title: Over 20m watched England win against Germany
description: The Football Association says it won't sell tickets for the match in Rome due to Covid restrictions.

title: Team GB name weightlifting trio for Games
description: Zoe Smith, Emily Campbell and Sarah Davies are selected for Great Britain's weightlifting team at this summer's Tokyo Olympics.

title: Search for missing US WW2 airmen begins in Arundel field
description: A B-24 Liberator crashed in a field in West Sussex during World War Two, killing several airmen.

title: Euro 2020: England fans celebrate after win against Germany
description: Some 40,000 fans inside Wembley stadium cheered as England beat Germany 2-0 in their last-16 clash.

title: Australia Covid: Seventh city locks down amid vaccine chaos
description: Government leaders offer conflicting advice about AstraZeneca as cases spread to new at-risk areas.

title: Euro 2020: England 2-0 Germany - Relive Raheem Sterling & Harry Kane's goals at Wembley
description: Relive the best action and reactions after England's iconic Euro 2020 win over Germany.

title: Batley and Spen by-election: What's at stake for the main political parties?
description: The constituency will be electing a new MP on Thursday, but the parties contesting the seat have a lot riding on the result.

title: Pinjra Tod: Freed India activists talk about hope and despair in jail
description: Natasha Narwal and Devangana Kalita, freed Indian activists, talk about hope and despair in jail.

title: Hong Kong: How life has changed under China's national security law
description: Seven city residents tell the BBC how the national security law fundamentally changed their lives.
